metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6441 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The lxc-sshd template (templates/lxc-sshd.in) in LXC before 1.0.0.beta2uses read-write permissions when mounting /sbin/init, which allows localusers to gain privileges by modifying the init file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6441` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblxc1 - 1.0.0~beta2-0ubuntu1
lua-lxc - 1.0.0~beta2-0ubuntu1
lxc - 1.0.0~beta2-0ubuntu1
lxc-templates - 1.0.0~beta2-0ubuntu1
lxc-tests - 1.0.0~beta2-0ubuntu1
python3-lxc - 1.0.0~beta2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lxc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.0~beta2-0ubuntu1').
